item.title: “Gang of Foxes.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Mueller’s writing a summer blockbuster, Fox and Friends is making immigration policy, and Scott Pruitt is late for dinner. Then the Rev. Demetrius Jifunza of the Florida Rights Restoration Coalition joins Jon, Jon, Tommy, and Dan on stage in Clearwater, Florida to talk about voting rights and second chances. Transcript

item.title: “Hold for Lou Dobbs.” | Pod Save America

item.description: Podcast Description Vice President Joe Biden sits down with Jon, Jon, and Tommy at his office in Washington, DC to talk about Donald Trump, John Bolton, partisanship, the economy, and the Biden Cancer Initiative. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Trump becomes even more unhinged, and makes warmonger John Bolton his national security advisor. item.description: Podcast Description Democrats win another special election, Republicans flail around for a response, and Trump sends Tillerson to the Rexit in a major shakeup of the national security team. Then Lovett and Tommy talk to Senator Elizabeth Warren. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description America sends its best negotiator to denuclearize a dictator, and Democrats craft an economic message for 2018. Then Texas Democratic Senate candidate Beto O’Rourke joins Jon, Jon, Tommy, Dan, and Brittany on stage live at Austin City Limits. Transcript

item.title: “The Committee to Defraud America.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Hope Hicks is out, Jared Kushner is in trouble, Jeff Sessions is beleaguered, and Donald Trump is so angry he just might…implement tariffs on steel and support gun control measures? item.title: “MAGA hats and perjury traps.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description The Stoneman Douglas students start to move the needle on gun control, the Schiff memo obliterates the Nunes memo, Trump’s lawyers are worried he’ll lie to Mueller, and Democrats have a few primary problems. item.description: Podcast Description In the aftermath of the Parkland shooting, a new student movement is born, the Republican/NRA conspiracy nuts go crazy, and Republican politicians start feeling the pressure. item.title: “Hold my putter.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description The Department of Justice indicts 13 Russian nationals who conducted information warfare against the United States, Mueller’s charges offer hints about his next move, Trump reacts on Twitter with his characteristic subtlety and cool, and the students of Stoneham Douglas lead a movement to stop mass shootings. item.title: “Beat the NRA.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description The NRA and GOP vow to do nothing about America’s 18th school shooting in 35 days, Trump and Republican leaders reject a bipartisan agreement to protect the dreamers, and the Administration is filled with corrupt goons who screw taxpayers and jeopardize national security. item.title: “The worst Cirque du Soleil ever.” (LIVE from Las Vegas) | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description The Trump White House extends the domestic abuse scandal for a fifth day, Republicans fret about staying on their tax message, and Democrats start to fight back. item.title: “A government eclipse.” (LIVE from Denver) | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Paul Ryan needs Democratic votes to keep the government open, and the Democrats can’t decide whether to demand a vote on dreamers. Jon, Jon, Tommy, Dan, and Alyssa are joined by business owner and community activist Wanda James live on stage in Denver, Colorado. Transcript

item.title: “#ReleaseThePod” (LIVE from LA’s Dolby Theater) | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description House Republicans give America its dumbest conspiracy yet. Jimmy Kimmel, John Legend, and Chrissy Teigen join Jon, Jon, Tommy, Dan, and Erin for a night of politics, games, and musical performances at the Dolby Theater in Los Angeles. Transcript

item.title: “An insult to banana republics.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Trump’s first State of the Union is long on words, low on energy, and short on policy. Jon and Dan break down the speech, the reaction, and all the Mueller Madness that followed with their guest, Ashley Parker of the Washington Post. Transcript

item.title: “A human centipede of obstruction.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description The media lowers the bar for Trump’s State of the Union, Democrats look for an economic message, and the Republican effort to shut down the Mueller investigation continues apace. item.title: “Paul Ryan’s shit sandwich.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Democrats plot their next move on immigration after the shutdown, Mueller closes in on Trump, and Republicans go full whack job in pushing their latest Deep State conspiracy. item.title: “Have fun at Davos!” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description The Shithole Shutdown ends as McConnell promises a vote on a bill to protect the DREAMers, and Democrats vote for another short-term funding bill. item.title: “The shithole shutdown.” | Pod Save America

Transcript

Jon, Jon, and Tommy do the pod live from Stockholm, Sweden. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description The guys look back on 2017 and the setbacks, surprising victories, lessons, frustrations and inspiring moments that defined a tough year. Also a few arguments over barking dogs. It’s the New Year’s Cuckin’ Eve clip show! Transcript

item.title: “We’re saying Pod Save America again.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description A very special Christmas mailbag with Jon, Jon, and Tommy to wrap up 2017 and look ahead to 2018. Transcript

item.title: “Keep your heads up.” | Pod Save America

item.title: “The perpetual bullshit machine.” | Pod Save America

Transcript

item.title: “Watch out for falling Keurigs.” | Pod Save America

Transcript

item.title: “Slack channel for the last adults.” (LIVE from Chicago!) | Pod Save America

item.title: "A cannibal who's for single-payer." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Graham-Cassidy goes down, Republicans embrace Roy Moore, and Trump lies about his tax plan. Then Senator Chuck Schumer joins Jon and Dan to talk about the Democratic strategy on taxes, and Ana Marie Cox joins to talk about Zuckerberg v. Trump. Transcript

item.title: "Stick to sports." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Trump starts a fight with two professional sports leagues, and Graham-Cassidy loses support. Then Axios’ Jim VandeHei joins Jon, Jon, and Tommy to talk about covering Trump, and DeRay discusses what it means to take a knee. Transcript

item.title: "Bad criminals." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Trump threatens to destroy North Korea at the UN, Cassidy keeps lying about his Obamacare repeal bill, and Mueller closes in on Manafort. Then NBC’s Katy Tur talks to Jon about covering Donald Trump. Transcript

item.title: “Sean Spicer is good now.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description The GOP makes one last run at repealing Obamacare, Democrats look for a message that works, and Trump delivers his first United Nations speech. Then HuffPost editor-in-chief Lydia Polgreen joins Jon, Jon, and Tommy to talk about the state of American democracy and the media, and DeRay Mckesson discusses the protest against police violence in St. Louis. Transcript

item.title: “Amnesty Don.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description The Democrats reach a tentative deal on DACA with Trump, and 16 Democratic Senators sign on to Bernie Sanders’ Medicare-for-All plan. Then New York Senator Kirsten Gillibrand joins Jon and Dan to talk about health care and the future of the Democratic Party, and Ana Marie Cox discusses Trump’s voter fraud commission. Transcript

item.title: Hillary Clinton | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description What Happened. Transcript

item.title: "Schumer's bump." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Irma portends the effects of climate change, the press heralds Trump as an independent dealmaker, and Bannon goes to war with Republicans. Then Erin Ryan joins Jon, Jon, and Tommy to talk about Hillary Clinton’s new book, What Happened. Transcript

item.title: "The misadventures of Paul RINO." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Trump cuts his first-ever deal as President with the Democrats on Harvey relief and the debt ceiling, and makes Republicans on the Hill very sad. Then, Senator Dick Durbin joins Jon and Dan to talk about passing the DREAM Act and the rest of Congress’s busy fall agenda. Transcript

item.title: "Trump always shoots the hostage." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description North Korea conducts a nuclear test. Sessions announces the end of DACA with a six month delay. And Jon, Jon, and Tommy are joined by Congressman Adriano Espaillat to discuss potential legislation to protect Dreamers and reform the immigration system. Plus a discussion of a New York Times piece on rising economic inequality. Transcript

item.title: “This snowflake is enraged.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Alyssa Mastromonaco joins the pod to talk about the response to Hurricane Harvey and Trump’s visit to Texas. Then, Jon and Dan discuss Trump’s tax reform speech, and his impending decision on the Deferred Action on Childhood Arrivals (DACA) program. Transcript

item.title: “You can’t be a woke Hungarian fascist.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Hurricane Harvey batters Texas with historic flooding, and Trump again obstructs justice by pardoning a racist sheriff before he’s even sentenced. Former Deputy FEMA Administrator Richard Serino discusses Harvey response efforts with Jon, Jon, and Tommy, and Demos President Heather McGhee joins to discuss how to address racial inequities in the wake of Charlottesville. Transcript

item.title: "Hits from the Aaron Sorkin bong." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Trump goes off the rails in Phoenix, and continues his war with the Republican Congress. Then Jon and Dan talk to focus group guru David Binder about Obama-Trump voters, and Ana Marie Cox joins to discuss the white nationalist resurgence. Transcript

item.title: “‘Committee to Save America’ my ass.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description White House staffers and Republican leaders debate what to do about Trump as he keeps a shrinking base and loses the rest of the country. Then Politico’s Eliana Johnson joins Jon, Jon, and Tommy to talk about Bannonism, Trumpism, and the future of the Republican Party. Transcript

item.title: “The dog whistle is now a bullhorn.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Trump’s press conference goes off the rails as he defends the ‘fine people’ who were chanting Nazi slogans in Charlottesville, and the world reacts to the madness. Then Jon and Dan talk to VICE News Tonight correspondent Elle Reeve about her Charlottesville reporting, as well as the Southern Poverty Law Center’s Lecia Brooks about the rise of white supremacist extremism. Transcript

item.title: “Denouncing Nazis is so fucking easy.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description White supremacists and neo-Nazis descend on Charlottesville to provoke violence, and President Trump gives a statement where he refuses to condemn them. Then DeRay Mckesson talks to Jon, Jon, and Tommy about his perspective on Charlottesville, and immigrants rights activist Julissa Arce joins in studio to discuss what we can do about new threats to the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) program. Transcript

item.title: "A song of fire and fury." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description The U.S. confronts a madman with nuclear weapons as well as Kim Jong Un, and Trump picks a fight with McConnell. Then NARAL President Ilyse Hogue joins Jon and Dan to talk about litmus tests, and Ana Marie Cox discusses Sinclair Broadcasting’s subtle propaganda. Transcript

item.title: “The MAGA industrial complex.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Mueller impanels a grand jury to investigate Trump, more Republicans start to challenge the President, and Democrats continue to debate their own way forward. Then Lovett interviews Joshua Green about his new Steve Bannon book, and Pod Save the People’s DeRay Mckesson joins to talk about the opioid crisis. Transcript

item.title: “Jeff Sessions’s mixtape.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description The Mooch Era is a short one, General Kelly takes control, Jeff Flake takes on Trump, and Trump and Sessions play the hits. Then Jon Lovett talks to Nevada Senator Catherine Cortez Masto about the future of the Democratic Party. Transcript

item.title: "9 parts hero, 1 part troll" (LIVE from Pasadena!) | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Reincey goes home, and the Resistance kills Trumpcare. Then Joy-Ann Reid and Symone Sanders join Jon, Jon, and Tommy to talk about the future of the Democratic Party. Transcript

item.title: Pod Save the Planet with Al Gore | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Former Vice President Al Gore talks with Jon, Jon, and Tommy about his new movie Inconvenient Sequel: Truth to Power. Lovett also made some jokes. Transcript

item.title: “This is like a car crash.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description The Mooch has a meltdown, Trump bullies Sessions, and tweets out a ban on transgender Americans serving in the military. Then Jon and Dan get a Trumpcare update from Senator Chris Murphy, and talk with John Podesta about Russian interference in our election. Transcript

item.title: “Mooch saves America.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Republicans have no idea what health care bill they’re voting on, the Mooch lets Trump be Trump, and the Democrats unveil a new slogan and agenda. Then CBS News’ Margaret Brennan joins Jon, Jon, and Tommy to talk about the Administration’s foreign policy challenges. Transcript

item.title: “One step away from drooling on himself.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Trumpcare is dead and alive and dead and alive again, and we discover from a terrifying New York Times interview that the President doesn’t actually know what health insurance is. Then Jon and Dan talk to Montana Governor Steve Bullock about his vision for the party and the country, and Ana Marie Cox joins to talk about Trump’s elimination of teen pregnancy prevention programs. Transcript

item.title: "Hack away, China." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description As the health care vote is delayed due to a medical emergency, Andy Slavitt, who ran Medicare, Medicaid & ACA for President Obama, lays out the strategy for this final push. Then Jon, Jon, and Tommy get into all the lies and revelations around the Trump Tower/Russia confab. And Tommy talks with Jeff Mason who leads the White House Correspondence Association to debate press access and freedom. Transcript

item.title: “Turd in the GOP punchbowl.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Donald Trump Jr. admits to a failed attempt at collusion, Republicans pretend it didn’t happen, and Mitch McConnell picks Ted Cruz over Medicaid in his new health care bill. Then Republican communications guru Tim Miller joins Jon and Dan to talk about where his party has gone wrong, and Ana Marie Cox discusses Trump’s presser with Macron. Transcript

item.title: "Propaganda, foreign and domestic." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description McConnell is down to a final few moves on health care. Don Jr. dissembles on yet another Trump campaign Russia meeting. Senator Al Franken stops by to talk about life in the Senate and his new book. And DeRay joins Jon, Jon, and Tommy to preview this week’s Pod Save the People. Transcript

item.title: "Making redistricting sexy again." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Trump holds a press conference in Warsaw in advance of the G20 conference, where he’ll meet face-to-face with Vladimir Putin and talk to the leaders of Japan and South Korea about the nuclear crisis in North Korea. Then Jon and Dan talk to former Attorney General Eric Holder about his redistricting efforts, and Ana Marie Cox joins to discuss CNN vs. Trump. Transcript

item.title: "Tweet your feelings." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description The President shares a video of him fake wrestling a CNN logo, Republicans face bad local headlines about their wealthcare bill, and a closer look at Trump’s fraudulent voter fraud commission. Then Jon and Tommy sit down with New Jersey Senator Cory Booker to talk about health care, criminal justice reform, and how to maintain optimism in the Trump era. Transcript

item.title: “Never bet against Mitch McConnell.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Jon and Tommy attend a health care rally outside the United States Capitol and talk to patients, doctors, activists, and politicians, including Senator Chris Van Hollen, Senator Brian Schatz, Congresswoman Debbie-Wasserman Schultz, Senator Ron Wyden, Senator Chris Murphy, and Senator Michael Bennet. Transcript

item.title: "Kill Bill Vol. 2." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description McConnell delays the wealthcare vote after a horrendous CBO score, and the resistance ramps up the pressure on wavering Republican Senators. Then, Jon and Dan talk to Massachusetts Congressman Joe Kennedy III about his views on health care, public service, and the future of the Democratic Party. Transcript

item.title: "CBO Brother, Where Art Thou?" | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Tommy and Jon discuss the ongoing efforts to ram Trumpcare through the Senate, and whether Obama did enough to respond to and deter Russian interference in our election. Then they discuss the impact of Trumpcare on West Virginia with Senator Joe Manchin. Transcript

item.title: "Same shitburger, different bun." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Guest host Alyssa Mastromonaco joins Dan to discuss the Secret Senate Health care bill that is no longer secret, the aftermath of the the Democrats’ loss in Georgia-06, and a ray of hope in Wisconsin. Then Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi talks to Lovett and Tommy about health care and next steps for the Democrats. Transcript

item.title: “We can win this fight.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description As McConnell moves toward a vote on the secret GOP health care bill, Lovett and Tommy are joined by Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer to talk about the Democratic strategy to defeat Trumpcare and what each of us can do to help. Plus, mounting tension between the US and Russia over Syria, the demise of the White House press briefing, and declining transparency across our government. Transcript

item.title: "Tiny, decent things." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description The aftermath of the Alexandria shooting, the investigation of the President, and the Democrats’ plan to stop health care. Then, former White House lawyer Danielle Gray joins Jon, Dan, and Tommy to talk about the travel ban, and Judge Tim Black discusses his ruling in the same-sex marriage case, Obergefell v. Hodges. Transcript

item.title: "All hands on deck." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description The Comey fallout continues, the left is resurgent in Europe, and the final showdown is near on #wealthcare. Then, Vox’s Sarah Kliff joins Jon, Jon, and Tommy to talk about the policy implications of the Senate health care bill, and DeRay McKesson joins to discuss his interview with Katy Perry. Transcript

item.title: "Comey came to play." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Jim Comey builds a case for obstruction of justice in testimony before the Senate Intelligence Committee, and Ranking Member of the House Intelligence Committee Adam Schiff joins Jon and Dan to break it down. Then, Trumpcare 2.0 gets new life in the Senate, and Ana Marie Cox joins to talk about the Republican reaction to Comey’s testimony. Transcript

item.title: “Some kind of decline.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Trump responds to terrorism in London by attacking the city’s mayor and his own Justice Department, while Capitol Hill prepares for The Comey Show. Then, Senator Chris Murphy (D-CT) talks to Jon, Jon, and Tommy about a progressive foreign policy and how politicians can talk like normal human beings, and Pod Save the People’s DeRay Mckesson joins to preview this week’s episode. Transcript

item.title: “More fucked than we think.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description As Trump prepares to withdraw from the Paris climate agreement, Jon and Dan talk about the consequences with one of the deal’s chief negotiators, Brian Deese. Then, they break down the politics of the decision, catch up on the latest Russia developments, and talk with Ana Marie Cox about Trump’s decision to rollback birth control coverage under Obamacare. Transcript

item.title: "The energy is in progressive politics." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Trump jeopardizes the NATO alliance on his “historically successful” foreign trip, Kushner conducts secret diplomacy with a Russian banker, and the Democrats hone their message after Montana. Then, Senator Elizabeth Warren joins Jon, Jon, and Tommy in studio to discuss the fights Democrats should wage on behalf of working Americans. Transcript

item.title: “The cycle of bullshit.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Trumpcare gets a CBO score so bad that it causes Republicans to lie, cry, and body-slam a reporter in Montana. Then, the Atlantic’s Annie Lowrey talks to Jon and Dan about Trump’s budget, and Ana Marie Cox joins with a look at the President’s foreign trip. Transcript

item.title: "Exhausted from Obstructing Justice." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Jon, Jon, and Tommy discuss Trump’s semester abroad, the latest on the investigations, right-wing lies about a tragedy, and what’s next for health care. With special guest: no one. Transcript

item.title: Pod Save America Takes Los Angeles | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Jon, Jon, Tommy, and Dan talk obstruction of justice and all the rest at the Ace Theater in Downtown LA. Plus Mayor Eric Garcetti joins to discuss the Democratic agenda and the lessons we can draw from success at the local level. Transcript

item.title: "Government by sucker punch." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description In the aftermath of Comey’s firing, what can Democrats do to hold Trump accountable? The Vice Chair of the Intel Committee, Senator Mark Warner, joins Jon, Jon, and Tommy to discuss the latest on the investigation. Plus DeRay on Sessions, Snowden, and more. Transcript

item.title: “Literally farcical.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Trump fires FBI Director Jim Comey in the middle of an investigation involving the Trump campaign’s potential collusion with Russia, and gets plenty of support from Republicans in Congress. Then, former White House Counsel Kathy Ruemmler joins Jon and Dan to talk about the legal implications of the Comey firing. Transcript

item.title: "Think globalist, act localist." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description French elections, Sally Yates’ testimony, Kushner family corruption, the latest on health care, and our interview with Senator Kamala Harris recorded live in front of a rowdy San Fransisco crowd. Transcript

item.title: Pod Save America Takes Seattle | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Jon, Jon, Tommy, and Dan hold a live show at Seattle’s Showbox SoDo Theater, where they’re joined by Washington Governor Jay Inslee to talk health care, activism, and the future of Democratic Party. Transcript

item.title: “The moment of truth for the resistance.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description House Republicans stake their careers on Trumpcare, and stopping the bill in the Senate becomes the biggest test yet for the resistance movement. Then, Virginia Democratic gubernatorial candidate Tom Perriello joins Jon and Dan to talk about the Democratic Party’s economic vision, and Ana Marie Cox joins to talk about health care. Transcript

item.title: BONUS POD with Trevor Noah | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Trevor Noah, host of The Daily Show, sits down with Jon, Jon, and Tommy to talk about how Trump changed comedy, his approach to political humor, and what he’s trying to achieve with The Daily Show. Transcript

item.title: "Doris Trump Goodwin." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Zombie RyanCare won’t die, Dickerson stumps Trump, the Times hires a conservative climate skeptic, the DCCC fails to invest in Montana, and Senator Amy Klobuchar joins Jon, Jon, and Tommy to talk about the Democratic message in the Midwest. Transcript

item.title: "A very 'Cuck You' week." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Trump looks for any kind of win before the 100-day mark, pushes Trumpcare 3.0, and proposes big tax cuts. Then, Pod Save the People host DeRay McKesson joins Jon and Dan to talk about his new podcast and the future of the Resistance. Transcript

item.title: "The odorless gas of misogyny." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Trump’s first 100 days end with a fight over funding for the wall. Plus health care, tax reform, and Teen Vogue’s Lauren Duca joins to discuss truth in the Trump era and the divides in the Democratic party. Transcript

item.title: “We’ll do it live.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Chaffetz and O’Reilly take extended vacations, Ossoff heads to a runoff, and the 2018 map looks bluer. Then, Governor Deval Patrick sits down with Jon and Dan to talk politics and the future of the Democratic Party, and Ana Marie Cox joins to ponder the Case of the Missing Aircraft Carrier. Transcript

item.title: "When you open the canister, snakes pop out." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description The latest on North Korea, the weekend’s tax marches, and how the health care town halls are working. Then Jon, Jon, and Tommy answer questions in the first Friend of the Pod Q & A. Transcript

item.title: “Game of Cucks.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Steve Bannon and pals have a bad week, Trump goes full Globalist, and still tries to hold health care hostage. Then, Obama pollster Cornell Belcher joins Jon and Dan to talk about the Democratic coalition, and Indivisible’s Ezra Levin talks about how you can get involved in the Tax March and Congressional Recess. Transcript

item.title: “The enemy of your enemy is your frenemy.” | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Trump strikes Syria and cable swoons, while the White House plays the Game of Cucks. Then, the Washington Post’s Ashley Parker joins Jon, Jon, and Tommy to talk about covering the Trump Administration, and VEEP’s David Mandel stops by to talk about the show’s sixth season. Transcript

item.title: "Thanks for unmasking" | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Ben Rhodes helps unmask the unmasking debate, Zombie Trumpcare makes a bad bill worse, Cecile Richards joins Jon and Dan to talk women and the resistance, and Ana Marie Cox discusses new Shadow President Jared Kushner. Transcript

item.title: "A garbage organization that protects harassers." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Trump’s popularity and agenda falter, Senate Democrats filibuster Neil Gorsuch, and Fox News lets Bill O’Reilly get away with sexual harassment. Then, climate scientist Dr. Katharine Hayhoe joins Jon, Jon, and Tommy to explain what people can do to fight climate change. Transcript

item.title: "The outrage meter is on tilt." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Republicans flirt with Trumpcare 2.0, Trump flirts with a government shutdown, and no one knows what the hell is going on with Nunes. Then, David Axelrod joins Jon and Dan to give advice to Democrats and Donald Trump. Transcript

item.title: "Blitzkrieg of blame." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Repeal and go f*ck yourself fails, Trump blames everyone but himself, and learns how hard it will be to pass the rest of his agenda. Then, Former Obama adviser Yohannes Abraham joins Jon, Jon, and Tommy to talk about the power of just showing up. Transcript

item.title: "He'll run the country from jail like El Chapo." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description The Russia story gets messier, Trump confirms the truth is dead, and Republicans try to take away health care from their voters. Then, new author Alyssa Mastromonaco joins Jon and Dan to reminisce, and Friends Like These host Ana Marie Cox stops by to talk health care. Transcript

item.title: "It's like late season Sopranos." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description FBI Director Comey confirms a Trump-Russia investigation, Trump alienates more allies, and Paul Ryan has keg dreams of cutting health care. Then Jon Ossoff, the Democratic candidate for Congress in Georgia’s 6th District, joins Jon, Jon, and Tommy to talk about what’s he’s learned from his race and what you can do to help. Transcript

item.title: Live @ SXSW: Crooked Media and Kara Swisher | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description The Crooked Media team talks live with notoriously tough interviewer Kara Swisher about their burgeoning media empire, Trump, and how to focus the resistance. Transcript

item.title: "Who pays for the wall? The elderly!" | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Trump runs into trouble with his ban, his budget, and his health care bill. Then, Barack Obama’s former Deputy Chief of Staff and Health Care Czar Nancy-Ann DeParle joins Jon and Dan to talk about the fight to pass and now save the Affordable Care Act. Transcript

item.title: Pod Save America takes Austin | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Health care lies dominate the Sunday shows, and Congress’s biggest racist strikes again. Then, Congressman Seth Moulton joins Jon, Jon and Tommy to talk about the future of the Democratic Party. Transcript

item.title: "The dogs who caught the car." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Paul Ryan struggles to pass a tax cut for the rich disguised as health care reform, and Vox.com’s Ezra Klein joins Jon and Dan to break down all the policy pitfalls of Trumpcare. Transcript

item.title: "The most damning conclusion of all." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Trump issues a new immigration ban, and peddles a deranged conspiracy about Obama tapping his phones. Then, Rep. Adam Schiff (D-CA) joins Jon, Jon, and Tommy to talk about his committee’s investigation into the contacts between Trump officials and Russia. Transcript

item.title: "The greatest speech in history." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Sessions lies about meetings with Russians, and Trump snows the pundits with his speech. Then, former Republican operative Nicolle Wallace joins Jon and Dan to talk about Obama-Trump voters and the future of the Republican Party. Transcript

item.title: "It's making us dumber." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description The latest on health care, Trump’s joint address to Congress, and Peter Hamby of Snapchat joins to talk about press access and the changing media landscape. Transcript

item.title: "A conversation about our divides." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Trump’s relatively tame week on Twitter, his orders on deportations and transgender policies, and the growing activism at town halls. Then Ana Marie Cox joins Jon and Dan to talk about her new Crooked Media podcast, With Friends Like These. Transcript

item.title: "Card-carrying badass." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Katie Couric joins for a freewheeling conversation about Trump’s attacks on the media, persuading Trump voters and the future of the Democratic Party. Transcript

item.title: "Caps lock freakout mode." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description General Flynn gets fired, the NYT’s report on Trump-Russia contacts, and the White House’s awful week. Then, the Atlantic’s Julia Ioffe joins Jon and Dan to talk Russia, and MoveOn.org’s Ben Wikler announces the launch of #ResistanceRecess. Transcript

item.title: "C'mon, Shinzo... they've paid me a fortune!" | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Trump holds national security talks in a crowded Mar-a-Lago ballroom. Flynn and Priebus are on the ropes. And DeRay McKesson joins Jon, Jon, and Tommy to discuss protest and activism. Transcript

item.title: Pod Save America Takes Brooklyn | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Jon, Jon and Tommy pierce their liberal bubble by traveling to Brooklyn for a live podcast. They’re joined by Mayor Bill de Blasio and Alex Wagner of CBS News. Transcript

item.title: "Can I call you Easy D?" | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description The threat posed by Attorney General Jeff Sessions, Trump’s battle against the judiciary, and the travails of Sean Spicer. Then, New York Magazine’s Jonathan Chait joins Jon and Dan to talk about Obama’s legacy and Trump’s first few weeks. Transcript

item.title: "A moment of silence for Bowling Green." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Behind the scenes of Trump’s first weeks, his attacks on the judiciary, and his not-so-populist revolution. Then Neera Tanden joins Jon, Jon and Tommy to discuss the fight to save ACA. Transcript

item.title: BONUS POD: "He has a lot of edits." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Cody Keenan, President Obama’s chief speechwriter in the second term, joins Jon and Jon to talk about speechwriting, working for Obama, and lessons learned over eight years in the White House. Transcript

item.title: "A season for happy warriors." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Jon and Dan talk about Trump’s bullying of Mexico and Australia, the promise of progressive protests, and Supreme Court nominee Neil Gorsuch. Then they’re joined by two DNC Chair candidates, Mayor Pete Buttigieg and South Carolina Democratic Party Chairman Jaime Harrison. Transcript

item.title: "Protest is the new brunch." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Jon, Jon and Tommy discuss Trump’s unconscionable Muslim ban and the politicization of national security. They’re joined by The Guardian’s Sabrina Siddiqui to discuss the global reaction to the EO, and then later by former White House lawyer Danielle Gray to discuss the EOs and Trump’s impending Supreme Court pick. Transcript

item.title: "What the hell are alternative facts?" | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Jon and Dan talk about Trump’s disturbing first week in office, including his Executive Orders, ABC interview, and voter fraud lies. Then they’re joined by DNC Chair candidate Tom Perez to talk about the future of the Democratic Party. Transcript

item.title: "The Mall sank into the earth." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Jon, Jon and Tommy talk about Trump’s inaugural address, the women’s marches across the US and Sean Spicer’s wonderful weekend. Then they’re joined by Seth Meyers from “Late Night with Seth Meyers”. Transcript

item.title: Obama's Last Interview | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description The Pod Save America team sits down with President Obama for his last interview as President. Transcript

item.title: "Congress scares easy." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Jon Favreau, Jon Lovett and Tommy Vietor talk about the rallies to preserve ACA, Trump’s twitter war with John Lewis and his creepy embrace of Russia. Then they’re joined by Erin Gloria Ryan to discuss covering the Trump White House and Philippe Reines talks about playing Donald Trump. Transcript

item.title: "We had plenty of ethical fun." | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Jon and Dan talk about Obama’s farewell and Trump’s press conference. Then, former Obama ethics czar Norm Eisen joins to talk about Trump’s decision to retain ownership of his business empire. For a closed-captioned version of this episode, please visit crooked.com/podsaveamerica. For a transcript of this episode, please email transcripts@crooked.com and include the name of the podcast. Transcript

item.title: "Repeal and go f*ck yourself." Our first episode! | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Jon Favreau, Jon Lovett and Tommy Vietor launch Pod Save America with a discussion of Russia hacking, cabinet confirmations, saving Obamacare and Obama’s final speech. Then they’re joined by Tamika Mallory and Linda Sarsour to discuss the Women’s March on Washington. Transcript

item.title: Teaser Episode | Pod Save America
item.description: Podcast Description Pod Save America launches Monday January 9th! Transcript
